workflow.name: Automate document approvals with multi-level workflows using Supabase & Gmail
workflow.description:
## Multi-Level Document Approval & Audit Workflow This workflow automates a **document approval process** using Supabase and Gmail. --- ### Who it‚Äôs for - Teams that need structured multi-level document approvals. - Companies managing policies, contracts, or proposals. - Medical document need multiple lavel of review and approval. --- ### How it works 1. **Form Trigger** ‚Äì A user submits a document via the form. 2. **Supabase Integration** ‚Äì The document is saved in the `documents` table. 3. **Supabase Storage** ‚Äì The document is saved in the bucket. 4. **Workflow Levels** ‚Äì Fetches the correct approval level from `workflow_levels`. 5. **Assign Approvers** ‚Äì Matches approvers by role from the `users` table. 6. **Approval Record** ‚Äì Creates an `approvals` record with a unique token and expiry. 7. **Email Notification** ‚Äì Sends an email with **Approve / Reject links**. 8. **Audit Logs** ‚Äì Records every approval request in `audit_logs`. 8. **Repeat** - repeat the flow till all the aproval level is comepted --- ### How to set up - Configure your **Supabase credentials**. - Create tables as per data model given. - Create a storage bucket in **Supabase Storage**. - Connect your **Gmail account**. - Adjust approval expiry time (`48h` default). - Deploy and test via the **Form Trigger**. --- ### Customization - Add multiple approval levels by chaining `workflow_levels`. - Replace Gmail with Slack, Teams, or another notification channel. - Adjust audit logging for compliance needs. - Update the endpoint http://localhost:5678/webhook-test/ based on instance and env (remove test if you run in prod) - Update the bucket name. --- ## Important steps ### 1. **Form Submit** - Triggered when by submiting form - Captures form parameters: - `Title` (Document Title) - `Description` (Document Description) - `file` (Document need for approval) ### 2. **Webhook Entry Point** - Triggered when an approver clicks the **Approve** or **Reject** link in email. - Captures query parameters: - `token` (approval token) - `decision` (approved/rejected) --- ### 3. **Approval Data Retrieval & Update** - Fetch approval record from **Supabase (approvals)** using `token`. - Update approval status: - `Approved` ‚Üí moves to next workflow level or final approval. - `Rejected` ‚Üí document marked as rejected immediately. - Records `acted_at` timestamp. --- ### 4. **Decision Check** - **IF Node** checks whether the decision is **approved** or **rejected**. - **Reject Path** ‚Üí Update document status to **Rejected** in `documents`. - **Approve Path** ‚Üí Continue workflow level progression. --- ### 5. **Workflow Level Progression** - Fetch details of the current workflow level. - Identify the **next level** (`workflow_levels`) based on `level_number`. #### ‚úÖ If Next Level Exists: - Retrieve approvers by `role_id`. - Generate unique approval tokens. - Create new approval records in `approvals`. - Send **email notifications** with approval/reject links. #### ‚ùå If No Next Level (Last Level): - Update document status to **Approved** in `documents`. --- ### 6. **Audit Logging** - Every approval action is logged into `audit_logs` table: - `document_id` - `action` (e.g., `approval_sent`, `approved`, `rejected`) - `actor_email` (system/approver) - `details` (workflow level, role info, etc.) --- ## üì® Email Template Approval request email includes **decision links**: ```html

Please review the document:

‚úÖ Approve | ‚ùå Reject

``` Happy Automating! üöÄ

parameters.content:
## Multi-Level Document Approval & Audit Workflow This workflow automates a **document approval process** using Supabase and Gmail. --- ### Who it‚Äôs for - Teams that need structured multi-level document approvals. - Companies managing policies, contracts, or proposals. - Anyone using **Supabase** as a backend with approval/audit requirements. --- ### How it works 1. **Form Trigger** ‚Äì A user submits a document via the form. 2. **Supabase Integration** ‚Äì The document is saved in the `documents` table. 3. **Workflow Levels** ‚Äì Fetches the correct approval level from `workflow_levels`. 4. **Assign Approvers** ‚Äì Matches approvers by role from the `users` table. 5. **Approval Record** ‚Äì Creates an `approvals` record with a unique token and expiry. 6. **Email Notification** ‚Äì Sends an email with **Approve / Reject links**. 7. **Audit Logs** ‚Äì Records every approval request in `audit_logs`. --- ### How to set up - Configure your **Supabase credentials**. - Update table IDs (`documents`, `workflow_levels`, `users`, `approvals`, `audit_logs`) to match your schema. - Connect your **Gmail account**. - Adjust approval expiry time (`48h` default). - Deploy and test via the **Form Trigger**. --- ### Requirements - A Supabase project with the listed tables. - A Gmail account connected to n8n. --- ### Customization - Add multiple approval levels by chaining `workflow_levels`. - Replace Gmail with Slack, Teams, or another notification channel. - Adjust audit logging for compliance needs. - Update the endpoint - http://localhost:5678/webhook-test/ based on instance and env (remove test if you run in prod) - Handle error in each step pf db interaction. --- ### 1. **Webhook Entry Point** - Triggered when an approver clicks the **Approve** or **Reject** link in email. - Captures query parameters: - `token` (approval token) - `decision` (approved/rejected) --- ### 2. **Approval Data Retrieval & Update** - Fetch approval record from **Supabase (approvals)** using `token`. - Update approval status: - `Approved` ‚Üí moves to next workflow level or final approval. - `Rejected` ‚Üí document marked as rejected immediately. - Records `acted_at` timestamp. --- ### 3. **Decision Check** - **IF Node** checks whether the decision is **approved** or **rejected**. - **Reject Path** ‚Üí Update document status to **Rejected** in `documents`. - **Approve Path** ‚Üí Continue workflow level progression. --- ### 4. **Workflow Level Progression** - Fetch details of the current workflow level. - Identify the **next level** (`workflow_levels`) based on `level_number`. #### ‚úÖ If Next Level Exists: - Retrieve approvers by `role_id`. - Generate unique approval tokens. - Create new approval records in `approvals`. - Send **email notifications** with approval/reject links. #### ‚ùå If No Next Level (Last Level): - Update document status to **Approved** in `documents`. --- ### 5. **Audit Logging** - Every approval action is logged into `audit_logs` table: - `document_id` - `action` (e.g., `approval_sent`, `approved`, `rejected`) - `actor_email` (system/approver) - `details` (workflow level, role info, etc.) --- ## üì® Email Template Approval request email includes **decision links**: ```html

Please review the document:

‚úÖ Approve | ‚ùå Reject

'''

## Database Schema

```sql
-- 1. ROLES: Define roles like Manager, Finance, HR
CREATE TABLE roles (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    description TEXT
);

-- 2. USERS: All approvers (internal + external flag)
CREATE TABLE users (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(150) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(200) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    role_id INT REFERENCES roles(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    is_external BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- 3. DOCUMENTS: The items that need approval
CREATE TABLE documents (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    content TEXT, -- could also just store metadata, file path, or S3 link
    submitted_by INT REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Pending', -- Pending / Approved / Rejected
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- 4. WORKFLOW LEVELS: Configure levels & roles
CREATE TABLE workflow_levels (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    level_number INT NOT NULL,
    role_id INT REFERENCES roles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    approval_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'any', -- any / all
    description TEXT
);

-- 5. APPROVALS: Tracks individual approval actions
CREATE TABLE approvals (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    document_id INT REFERENCES documents(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    level_id INT REFERENCES workflow_levels(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    approver_id INT REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    token VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL UNIQUE, -- one-time token for secure link
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'Pending', -- Pending / Approved / Rejected
    expiry_time TIMESTAMP,
    acted_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- 6. AUDIT LOGS (optional, for tracking history)
CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    document_id INT REFERENCES documents(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    action VARCHAR(50), -- submitted / approved / rejected / escalated
    actor_email VARCHAR(200),
    details TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

user.name: Alok Kumar
user.bio: I am a Principal Software Engineer based in Ireland with a deep passion for AI and emerging technologies. With extensive experience in designing and implementing scalable software solutions, I focus on leveraging artificial intelligence to solve real-world problems. I enjoy exploring innovative applications of AI, from intelligent automation to data-driven insights, and I‚Äôm dedicated to building systems that are both efficient and impactful.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Crypto node allows you to hash and Hmac string in a specified format and sign a string using a private key. Use this node when you want to encrypt your data.
